channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Meet Greg Abel, the new boss of Berkshire Hathaway—Warren Buffett’s successor started out by selling empty soda bottles for 5 cents and now he’s a billionaire CEO
item.description: Warren Buffett’s successor Greg Abel first made money dispersing fliers and redeeming empty soda bottles. Now he's the billionaire CEO of Berkshire Ha...

item.title: ‘Big Short’ investor Michael Burry says toppling of Venezuela’s Maduro will weaken Russia’s global standing as its oil ‘just became less important’
item.description: Russia’s oil exports are its “lifeline” and largely fund its war on Ukraine, says one economist.

item.title: Forget an MBA: Hasbro forces workers to sit through a Monopoly-style board game to see if they’re fit for the C-suite—and it’s a tactic approved by Reid Hoffman
item.description: Toy giant Hasbro is using a strategy game to train future CEOs—and leaders like Reid Hoffman and Elon Musk have long been fans of using games to learn...

item.title: Zelensky Taps High-Profile Canadian Politician as Economic Adviser
item.description: Ukraine’s president appointed Chrystia Freeland, a former deputy prime minister of Canada, to a role in which she would advise on postwar reconstructi...

item.title: Don’t Call It Regime Change. This Is Something Else Entirely.
item.description: To understand what’s unfolding in Venezuela, you have to look to the mob, not traditional foreign policy doctrines.

item.title: Janet Yellen warns the $38 trillion national debt is testing a red line economists have feared for decades
item.description: Top economists fear the era of fiscal dominance is here, and we’ve abandoned the debt problem already.

item.title: Could Venezuela be another Iraq or Afghanistan? Lessons from American statecraft in force and legitimacy
item.description: Reemoving a leader — even a brutal and incompetent one — is not the same as advancing a legitimate political order.

item.title: Jamie Dimon’s $770 Million Haul Shows How Bankers Are on Top Again
item.description: The Trump administration is lifting regulations, and deal making is heating up. For Jamie Dimon, being JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive was more lucra...

item.title: New Guidelines Endorse Self-Swab Alternative to Pap Smear for Cervical Cancer Testing
item.description: The recommendation comes after the first at-home test, a self-swab, received federal approval last year.

item.title: Iran Offering Monthly Payments to Citizens to Cool Protests
item.description: The payments are the latest step to alleviate economic pressures, but given the severity of the crisis, critics say, they are likely to do little.

item.title: After Christmas Day Strikes, Fear Grips Muslims in Rural Nigeria
item.description: A small town set amid a smattering of baobab trees is grappling with the aftermath of a bombing ordered by President Trump.

item.title: Venezuela’s ‘Dirty’ Oil and the Environment: Three Things to Know
item.description: Most of the reserves in the country are extra-heavy oil that’s tough to extract and generates more greenhouse gases.

item.title: Venezuela Live Updates: Maduro Tells U.S. Judge He Was ‘Kidnapped’
item.description: Nicolás Maduro, the ousted Venezuelan leader, and his wife pleaded not guilty to drug trafficking and other federal charges. “I am still president of ...

item.title: Trump’s Threat of Force Against Colombia Draws Rebuke From Its Leader
item.description: President Gustavo Petro said that he had asked the Colombian people to defend him “against any illegitimate violent act.” His defense minister emphasi...
